subject: RE: [junit] Re: Mock objects, how to use them?
msgSnippet: Don t underestimate the value of writing mock objects by hand. If you feel pain because you need to write large mock objects, or if you are mocking a large
messageBody:
Don't underestimate the value of writing mock objects by hand.

If you feel pain because you need to write large mock objects, or if you are mocking a large interface and only implementing a small part of it, then you may be testing the wrong thing -- or at least, the wrong thing first.

Take care.

So said Ilja Preuss on 4/10/2003 --------------------
> What Mock solution would you choose? I read about EasyMock. Is it
> better then MockObjects?

They are simply different.

EasyMock is good when

- you want to mock interfaces (this is a prerequisite), and
- you want to mock a small number of method calls, or
- you need a dummy implementation (you don't care about specific return
values that much).

MockObjects is good when

- you can reuse one of the predefined mock classes
- you need to write a complex custom mock

Regards, Ilja
